sourceMeaningMnemonic: Your <radical>mouth</radical> has some hidden <radical>horns</radical>, and if you have the right <radical>alcohol</radical> <radical>measurement</radical> in your body, those horns will come out of your mouth in the form of <kanji>rumor</kanji>s and <kanji>gossip</kanji>.
meaningInfo: It's really easy for you to let a rumor slip if you've had a certain amount of alcohol. And those rumors have horns, they're dangerous.
readingMnemonic: When you start to tell a <kanji>rumor</kanji> or spread <kanji>gossip</kanji>, you're a little drunk, so you slur you words. "<reading>Ooo I saw</reading> (<ja>うわさ</ja>)..." is how you start every rumor. It's got some southern drawl to it almost (Uuuwahsahw).
readingInfo: If someone who looks a little drunk comes up to you and starts with <ja>うわさ</ja>, there is a 100% chance what follows is gossip.
